moves.1. d4: In this game my many early mistakes were overcome, while my opponent's late mistake proved fatal.  My opening was actually very well put together.
moves.1... e6 2. e4: at this point im thinking about getting one of those center pawns to the 5th rank
moves.3... Ba5 4. e5: 5th rank and the great wall is complete
moves.4... Nc6: right about here I started thinking about possibilities on that wide open kingside...
moves.5. Qg4: thought #1 trap that rook in the corner
moves.5... Kf8: Kf8 ends that thought... but opens up fork possibilities and a lot of them.  pretty far off though.  Right here i think black should have played g6.
moves.6. Nf3: thought #2: get that knight to f7
moves.6... d5: not worried about that move, but it frees black queen a bit
moves.7... Bb6: ? couldnt figure this out except maybe give knight a way out...
moves.8. Ng5: meanwhile im setting up this fork and its going swell...
moves.8... h6: black threatens the knight i want to move anyways...  unfortunately im about to get greedy and make my first mistake...  let me just admire my handywork setting this up before i move to 9.
moves.9. Nxe6+: so with two forking possibilities i got greedy and went for the queen, and didnt see the bishop.  should have went Nxf7
moves.9... Bxe6 10. Bd3: with that idea over i need to develop some pieces
moves.10... a6 11. O-O: safely stowed away, king and pawns dont move again all game.
moves.11... f5: with this move he had fairly good position on me...
moves.12. Bxf5: so i figured i would make the exchange - bishop for bishop and i gain a pawn
moves.14... Nxd4: but he baits me into this one...
moves.15... Bxd4: Forked me, but i have some tricks up my sleeve... good thing i set up that check - Ba3
moves.17... Bxc5 18. Nc3 Bd4: now my knight is forked but rook comes to the rescue
moves.19. Rac1 Rc8: he's putting a lot of pressure on c3, and i cant combat it so i figure if i lose my knight he's losing his.  i start the exchange again
moves.20. exf6: this also positions my pawn on the 6th rank which is very important in the end
moves.20... Bxc3:
he should have grabbed that pawn, Bf6.  now bishop is pinned to his rook, but more importantly that space c8.  Not often i care about getting a space as much as this

if that bishop moves i have this game,
moves.21... Bxe1: and he took it, my heart was jumping right here!  i knew i was in good shape!
moves.22. Rxc8: queen is pinned to king.  and rook is protected by queen.  either way i get his queen... possibly i get his queen and rook while losing that rook a few moves ago.  pretty good turn around.
moves.24. Qd7: protect my rook and threaten the queens space
moves.25... Bxd8 26. Qxd8+: woohoo! i get the rook too
moves.26... Kf7 27. Qxh8: and protect that all important pawn
moves.27... Ke6 28. Qd8: again protect my advanced pawn, but also take care of his pawn
moves.28... Ke5 29. f7 d3 30. f8=Q: just a matter of time now
moves.30... d2: futile, but one mistake from stealing this back
moves.31. Qfe8+ Kf4 32. Qd4+ Kg5 33. Qee5#: matey,   game was full of mistakes and fortunate turns
